ud4.3:1.2: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants.
ud4.3:1.3: And then the Buddha left the road, went to the root of a tree, and sat down on the seat spread out.
ud4.3:2.1: Then a certain cowherd went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.
ud4.3:2.2: The Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a Dhamma talk.
ud4.3:3.1: Then the cowherd said to the Buddha,
ud4.3:3.2: “Sir, may the Buddha together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept tomorrow’s meal from me.”
